quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: He who asks a question is a fool for five minutes; he who does not ask a question remains a fool forever.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

quote: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true wisdom.
author: Confucius

quote: Wisdom begins in wonder.
author: Socrates

quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
author: Plato

quote: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.
author: Matsuo Bashō

quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.
author: Confucius

quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: In seeking wisdom thou art wise; in imagining that thou hast attained it—thou art a fool.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: A man’s true wealth is the good he does in the world.
author: Muhammad

quote: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

quote: Wisdom is knowing the right path to take. Integrity is taking it.
author: M.H. McKee

quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
author: Marilyn Vos Savant

quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: He that is good with a hammer tends to see every problem as a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: A closed mind is like a closed book; just a block of wood.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Wisdom is the daughter of experience.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The heart of the wise inclines to the right, but the heart of the fool to the left.
author: Ecclesiastes

quote: Experience is the teacher of fools and the fool of experience.
author: Saki (H.H. Munro)

quote: A wise man adapts himself to circumstances, as water shapes itself to the vessel that contains it.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
author: H.L. Mencken

quote: You cannot open a book without learning something.
author: Confucius

quote: We learn from failure, not from success!
author: Bram Stoker

quote: Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

quote: Life has but one wisdom, to free men from fear and slavery.
author: Epictetus

quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
author: Seneca

quote: Time tests the sincerity of a man’s love.
author: Arab Proverb

quote: Speak only if it improves upon the silence.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: He who knows best knows how little he knows.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: The wise does at once what the fool does at last.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

quote: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: The tongue has no bones, but is strong enough to break a heart.
author: Unknown

quote: It’s not what you look at that matters, it’s what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The wise man bridges the gap by laying out the path by means of which he can get from where he is to where he wants to go.
author: J.P. Morgan

quote: He who defends everything, defends nothing.
author: Aristotle

quote: Learning without thought is labor lost; thought without learning is perilous.
author: Confucius

quote: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: To know thyself is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Socrates

quote: Doubt is the origin of wisdom.
author: René Descartes

quote: Wisdom outweighs any wealth.
author: Sophocles

quote: Empty your cup so that it may be filled; become devoid to gain totality.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Wisdom begins at the end.
author: Daniel Defoe

quote: The wise adapt themselves to circumstances, as water molds itself to the pitcher.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: True wisdom is remembering that in the end, no matter what, everything will be fine.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: To understand everything is to forgive everything.
author: Buddha

quote: A wise man changes his mind, a fool never will.
author: Spanish Proverb

quote: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: The pursuit of wisdom is a lot like wrestling a gorilla. You don’t quit when you’re tired—you quit when the gorilla is tired.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: All human wisdom is contained in these two words—‘Wait and hope.’
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: Wisdom is to the soul what health is to the body.
author: Aristotle

quote: No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible.
author: Voltaire

quote: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge.
author: Parker J. Palmer

quote: The wise man does not expose himself needlessly to danger, since there are few things for which he cares sufficiently; but he is willing, in great crises, to give even his life—knowing that under certain conditions it is not worthwhile to live.
author: Aristotle

quote: Wisdom is the sunlight of the soul.
author: German Proverb

quote: The wise man knows he knows nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: A wise person once said: we do not hear what we say; we say what we hear.
author: Anthony de Mello

quote: Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.
author: Sophocles

quote: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Wisdom without courage is like a ship without a rudder.
author: Unknown

quote: A book holds a house of gold.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Wisdom is the daughter of experience.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The heart of the wise inclines to the right, but the heart of the fool to the left.
author: Ecclesiastes

quote: Wisdom is the power to put our time and knowledge to the best possible use.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: Wisdom is more precious than rubies.
author: Proverbs 8:11

quote: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

quote: Wisdom is on the lips of the aged, and understanding in length of days.
author: Job 12:12

quote: Wisdom overpowers the strength of the mighty.
author: Sirach 3:19

quote: Whoever walks with the wise becomes wise.
author: Proverbs 13:20

quote: Wisdom rests in the heart of the discerning and even among fools she lets herself be known.
author: Proverbs 14:33

quote: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom.
author: Proverbs 4:7
